channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.description:
Report X-2023111331

item.title: Report X-2023111282
item.description:
Report X-2023111282

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-17
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: TWILIGHT SHIFT RECIEVED THE CALL AND THE RESPONDER PICKED UP THE PACKAGE AT THE DOOR. WHEN BROUGHT BACK TO THE CAGE AND THE LEAKING CONTAINER EXAMINED, IT WAS FOUND THAT THE LID DID NOT HAVE THE INTERNAL SEAL ON THE OPENING.

item.title: Report X-2023111145
item.description:
Report X-2023111145

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-16
  • City: HAMMOND
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: jERRICAN WAS MISHANDLED WHILE UNLOADING WHICH CAUSED THE TOP OF THE LID TO CRACK CAUSING A SMALL SPILLAGE DescribePack: THE CAP WAS CRACKED DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: AREA WAS CLOSED OFF, JERRICAN WAS PLACED IN A HAZMAT DRUM AND TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT AREA. AREA WHERE SPILL TOOK PLACED WAS CLEANED AND OPERATION CONTINUED.

item.title: Report X-2023110825
item.description:
Report X-2023110825

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-07
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND UPON INSPECTION DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT. FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED PACKAGE NOTICEABLY WET AND UPON INSPECTION OF PACKAGE FOUND THAT 1 OF 4 GALLON BOTTLES WERE SHIPPED WITH A LOOSE CAP. LEAKAGE FROM THIS PACKAGE CAUSED AN INCIDENT, RESULTING IN AN INJURY TO AN EMPLOYEE. DescribePack: FAILED AT TOP CAP/ LOOSE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT, IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM ALL OTHER PACKAGES.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver brought back package, he noticed it leaking when he went to deliver. DescribePack: The lid was not on tight so when the package was moved it splashed out. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Put gloves on and tightened the lid.

item.title: Report X-2023110650
item.description:
Report X-2023110650

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: EVANSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I went to process a batch of hazmats that had just been unloaded and found one that a package handler had laid on its side. I promptly righted it, taking care not to touch a spot that looked wet and corrected the package handler to ensure it does not happen again. Box was inspected on the spot and found to have corrosion on the inside of the box and on the handles of the bottles. Box was then safely removed to be handled elsewhere. DescribePack: Caps were slightly loose, just enough to leak when jostled. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was righted and then removed into a spill tote to prevent it leaking onto its surroundings.
